arch:property.oc:show_val: Possible water drain located in south part of trench. Area of soft soil between hard packed mudbrick collapse/slough, L2025 and L2026. This softer soil was removed to reveal a 2m long trough running east-west into the baulks which may have served as a water drainage system. Trough runs parallel to L2010 mudbrick wall and its position is skewed in relation to L2006 and L2020 mudbrick walls.
water drain? foundation trench for L2010

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

arch:property.oc:show_val: trough filled with loose soil debris. Linear trough/trench cut into extremely hard mudbrick material. Trough runs roughly NE-SW.

oc:metadata.dc:title: Kenan Tepe: Area A / Trench 2 / Locus 2024 (Locus)
